com.camerontec.util.io

Class BytesSegmentOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • com.camerontec.util.io.BytesSegmentOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public final class BytesSegmentOutputStream
extends OutputStream
    Specialization of an java.io.OutputStream which uses a BytesSegment as its data sink.

    This stream has the capability of being layered on top of different BytesSegment instances without object creation via its wrap(BytesSegment) method.

    This stream also takes advantage of the BytesSegment's ability to be resized. Attempts to write more bytes than the advertised capacity() result in the underlying sink segment being grown rather than failure of the write operation.

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        public void wrap(BytesSegment segmentToWrap)
        Wrap the specified BytesSegment so that it becomes the sink of all future operations.

        This method assumes ownership of the specified segment. That is, data currently in the segment before the call are not guaranteed to be there after the call.

        Parameters:
        segmentToWrap - The sink segment. This may not be null.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the contents of the sink BytesSegment without removing the underlying byte array.

        Delegates to BytesSegment.clearSegment().

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Return the spare capacity in the underlying sink segment.
        Returns:
        The number of spare bytes in the underlying sink. This corresponds to the number of bytes which may be written without causing the underlying sink segment to grow.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Return the total capacity of the underlying sink segment.
        Returns:
        The sink segment's capacity in bytes.
